summary: William O. Cregar, also referred to as W. O. Cregar or simply Cregar, is mentioned in the context of FBI activities during the 1970s, specifically in relation to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC). The documents suggest Cregar was involved in the FBI's responses to the SSC's requests for information regarding intelligence activities, including investigations into Martin Luther King, Jr., COINTELPRO, and other sensitive matters. While his specific role is not explicitly detailed, the documents indicate his involvement in the FBI's internal processes for gathering, reviewing, and providing information to the SSC, including managing information disclosure and coordinating responses to congressional inquiries.
key_connections: Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities
Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC)
